newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-MANCHESTER UNITED MOVE FOUR POINTS CLEAR IN ENGLAND.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-MANCHESTER UNITED MOVE FOUR POINTS CLEAR IN ENGLAND.

text.p: Defending champions Manchester United pulled four points clear in the English premier league on Saturday with two goals in the opening five minutes setting them up for a 3-1 win over strugglers Coventry City.

An own goal by Coventry's new 2.0 million pounds ($3.6 million) defender Gary Breen after four minutes, and a second from Andy Cole which took a deflection off Eoin Jess a minute later plus a second-half strike from Czech striker Karel Poborsky put United on 57 points --four ahead of Liverpool who play Aston Villa on Sunday. Darren Huckerby scored a late consolation for Coventry.

Arsenal ended a run of four league matches without a win with a 2-0 victory at Everton thanks to goals from Dennis Bergkamp and Ian Wright. They move into third place on 51 points -- two ahead of Newcastle who surprisingly lost 1-0 at home to Southampton. Matt le Tissier scored the Saints winner after 56 minutes.

Frank LeBouef, Chelsea's hero when he scored the late penalty in their 1-0 F.A. Cup win over Leicester on Wednesday, scored again in Chelsea's 3-2 defeat at Derby -- but got sent off in the second half for deliberate handball. Leicester bounced back to win 3-1 at Wimbledon.
Bottom-placed Middlesbrough moved a step nearer the drop when they lost 3-1 at Sheffield Wednesday.
